00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the Machine class.
00017 
00018 #ifndef __MACHINE_HPP
00019 #define __MACHINE_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <types.hpp>
00022 #include <data.hpp>
00023 #include <stack.hpp>
00024 #include <state.hpp>
00025 #include <script.hpp>
00026 #include <thread.hpp>

00028 #include <neighbourhood.hpp>

00033 /// A virtual machine.
00034 /**
00035  * \note This class is \ref extending "extensible".
00036  */
00037 class Machine : public MachineExtension {
00038     
00039     public:
00040         
00041         /// The ID of this Machine.
00042         MachineId id;
00043         
00044         /// The standard stack.
00045         Stack<Data> stack;
00046         
00047         /// The environment stack.
00048         Stack<Data> environment;
00049         
00050         /// The globals.
00051         Stack<Data> globals;
00052         
00053         /// The threads.
00054         /**
00055          * \see Thread
00056          */
00057         Array<Thread> threads;
00058         
00059         /// The (index of the) current thread when executing a run.
00060         /**
00061          * When not running, this is the index of the thread that will be checked first for the next run.
00062          */
00063         Thread::Id current_thread;
00064         
00065         /// The state variables.
00066         Array<State> state;
00067         
00068         /// The list of all the neighbours.
00069         NeighbourHood hood;
00070         
00071     protected:
00072         
00073         /// A pointer to the next instruction.
00074         Address instruction_pointer;
00075         
00076         /// Boolean indicating whether execution (installation or a single run) has finished.
00077         bool is_finished;
00078         
00079         /// The callback stack.
00080         /**
00081          * \see call
00082          * \see retn
00083          */
00084         Stack<Instruction> callbacks;
00085         
00086         /// The current neighbour, when iterating through them.
00087         /**
00088          * Used by the hood instructions when iterating through the hood to let the neighbour-instructions know which neighbour is currently being processed.
00089          */
00090         NeighbourHood::iterator current_neighbour;
00091         
00092         /// The (index of the) current import/export, when executing a hood instruction.
00093         /**
00094          * Used by the hood folding instructions.
00095          */
00096         Index current_import;
00097         
00098         friend void Instructions::DEF_VM(Machine &);
00099 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00100         friend void Instructions::DEF_VM_EX(Machine &);
00101 #endif
00102         friend void Instructions::EXIT(Machine &);
00103         friend class HoodInstructions;
00104         
00105     public:
00106         
00107         /// The constructor.
00108         Machine() : instruction_pointer(0), callbacks(1) {}
00109         
00110         /// \name Execution control
00111         /// \{
00112             
00113             /// Start an installation script.
00114             /**
00115              * \note This does not execute the installation script, it only prepares it. Call step() while not finished() to execute it.
00116              * 
00117              * \param script A pointer to the installation script.
00118              */
00119             inline void install(Int8 const * script) {
00120                 is_finished = false;
00121                 jump(Address(script));
00122                 callbacks.push(0);
00123             }
00124             
00125             /// Start the next scheduled task.
00126             /**
00127              * \note This does not execute Proto code, it only prepares the next run. Call step() while not finished() to execute it.
00128              */
00129             inline void run() {
00130                 is_finished = true;
00131                 for(Size i = 0; i < threads.size(); i++){
00132                     if (threads[current_thread].pending()){
00133                         threads[current_thread].untrigger();
00134                         jump(globals.peek(current_thread).asAddress());
00135                         callbacks.push(run_callback);
00136                         is_finished = false;
00137                         return;
00138                     }
00139                     current_thread++;
00140                     if (current_thread >= threads.size()) current_thread = 0;
00141                 }
00142             }
00143             
00144         protected:
00145             static void run_callback(Machine & machine){
00146                 machine.threads[machine.current_thread].result = machine.stack.pop();
00147                 for(Size i = 0; i < machine.state.size(); i++){
00148                     if (machine.state[i].thread == machine.current_thread){
00149                         if (!machine.state[i].is_executed) machine.state[i].data.reset();
00150                         machine.state[i].is_executed = false;
00151                     }
00152                 }
00153                 machine.current_thread++;
00154                 if (machine.current_thread >= machine.threads.size()) machine.current_thread = 0;
00155             }
00156             
00157         public:
00158             /// Execute the next instruction.
00159             /**
00160              * \note Do not use this function when already finished().
00161              */
00162             inline void step() {
00163                 execute(instructions[nextInt8()]);
00164             }
00165             
00166             /// Check whether the running script (installation or a single run) has finished (true) or not (false).
00167             inline bool finished() {
00168                 return callbacks.empty();
00169             }
00170             
00171         /// \}
00172         
00173         /// \name Control flow
00174         /// \{
00175             
00176             /// Jump to another address.
00177             /**
00178              * \param address The address to jump to.
00179              */
00180             inline void jump(Address address) {
00181                 instruction_pointer = address;
00182             }
00183             
00184             /// Advance the instruction pointer.
00185             /**
00186              * \param distance The number of bytes to skip.
00187              */
00188             inline void skip(Size distance) {
00189                 instruction_pointer += distance;
00190             }
00191             
00192             /// Call a function.
00193             /**
00194              * \param address The address of the first instruction of the function.
00195              * \param callback Called when the function returns.
00196              */
00197             inline void call(Address address, Instruction callback = 0) {
00198                 callbacks.push(callback);
00199                 stack.push(instruction_pointer);
00200                 jump(address);
00201             }
00202             
00203             /// Return from a function.
00204             /**
00205              * If the corresponding call (if any) registered a callback, it will be called.
00206              * 
00207              * \see Instructions::RET
00208              */
00209             inline void retn() {
00210                 Instruction callback = callbacks.pop();
00211                 Data result = stack.pop();
00212                 if (!callbacks.empty()) jump(stack.popAddress());
00213                 if (!(callbacks.empty() && !callback)) stack.push(result);
00214                 if (callback) callback(*this);
00215             }
00216             
00217             /// Get the current address (instruction pointer).
00218             inline Address currentAddress() const {
00219                 return instruction_pointer;
00220             }
00221             
00222             /// Get the callback depth.
00223             /**
00224              * Usually 1, but higher inside instructions such as \ref Instructions::INIT_FEEDBACK "INIT_FEEDBACK" or \ref Instructions::TUP_MAP "TUP_MAP".
00225              */
00226             inline Counter depth() const {
00227                 return callbacks.size();
00228             }
00229             
00230         /// \}
00231         
00232         /// \name Low level
00233         /// \{
00234             
00235             /// Read the next byte(s) as an unsigned integer.
00236             /**
00237              * Using the Variable Length Quantity (VLQ)
00238              * format as used in the MIDI file format.
00239              * 
00240              * \see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variable-length_quantity
00241              */
00242             inline Int nextInt() {
00243                 Int value = 0;
00244                 while(true){
00245                     Int8 next = *instruction_pointer++;
00246                     value |= next & 0x7F;
00247                     if (next & 0x80) value <<= 7;
00248                     else break;
00249                 }
00250                 return value;
00251             }
00252             
00253             /// Read the next byte as an unsigned 8-bit integer.
00254             /**
00255              * \deprecated Use nextInt() instead.
00256              */
00257             inline Int8 nextInt8() {
00258                 return *instruction_pointer++;
00259             }
00260             
00261             /// Read the next two bytes as an unsigned 16-bit integer (big endian).
00262             /**
00263              * \deprecated Use nextInt() instead.
00264              */
00265             inline Int16 nextInt16() {
00266                 Int16 data  = static_cast<Int16>(nextInt8()) << 8;
00267                       data += nextInt8();
00268                 return data;
00269             }
00270             
00271             /// Execute an instruction.
00272             /**
00273              * \param instruction The Instruction to execute.
00274              * 
00275              * \see Instructions
00276              */
00277             inline void execute(Instruction instruction) {
00278                 instruction(*this);
00279             }
00280             
00281         /// \}
00282         
00283         /// \name Neighbour methods
00284         /// \{
00285             
00286             /// Get the current neighbour, when iterating through them.
00287             /**
00288              * Used by the hood instructions when iterating through the hood to let the neighbour-instructions know which neighbour is currently being processed.
00289              */
00290             inline Neighbour & currentNeighbour() {
00291                 return *current_neighbour;
00292             }
00293             
00294             /// Get the Neighbour representing this machine.
00295             inline Neighbour & thisMachine() {
00296                 return *hood.begin();
00297             }
00298             
00299         /// \}
00300 };
00301 
00302 #endif
